branchAndBound
Class BranchAndBound<Solution>

java.lang.Object
  branchAndBound.BranchAndBound<Solution>

public class BranchAndBound<Solution>
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a generic branch and bound algorithm. The generic Solution is used to return the solution at the end of the algorithm. This class heavily relies on the interface Node, that is used to generate and test all nodes of the tree search. The main procedure is run(). The code of this procedure is the following. 

 // nodeStack is the stack of nodes. It is initialized with the root node.
 // When a node is processed, it is either dropped, or its next child is created an pushed on the stack
 
 	while(! nodeStack.empty()){ // while there are still nodes to process
 	    Node<Solution> current = nodeStack.peek();
 
 	    if(current.isLeaf()){ // if the node is a leaf, we verify if it is the best solution so far
 
 		nodeStack.pop(); // a leaf is automatically popped from the stack
 		if(current.isFeasible() && current.getValue() < bestUB){
 		    bestLeaf = current;
 		    bestUB = current.getValue();
 
 		    // if the solution is proven optimal, we return this solution
 		    if(bestUB == rootLB){
 			return bestUB;
 		    }
 		}
 	    }
 
 	    else{ // inner node (not a leaf)
 
 		// remove the current node from the stack if it has no more children or if its lower bound is too large
 		if(current.getLB() > bestUB || ! current.hasNextChild()){ 
 		    nodeStack.pop(); // if it cannot lead to an improving solution, it is popped
 		}
 
 		else{ // the node has potentially improving children
 		    nodeStack.push(current.getNextChild()); // we add the next child and keep the current partial solution in the stack
 		}
 		
 	    }
 
 	}
 
 	return bestUB;

Method Summary
 Solution getSolution()

          Print the stats of the search (number of iterations, time spent and solution found)
 double run(int timeLimit)
          run the branch&bound method the best solution found is recovered by calling function getSolution() if no solution is found, hasSolution will return false and getSolution() will return null
 void setVerbose(boolean verb)
          set verbosity to verb verbosity = messages printed at each node during the search (for debugging)
